parameters.name: assignedTrack
parameters.description:
Track to assign to the camera.
For example:
{ "trackToAssign": "COM0100002"}

operations.notes: Retrieves the current Camera Image as a jpeg

parameters.name: cacheId
parameters.description:
Optional user-chosen value to provide a 'context' for the request.
This serves two purposes:
First, to ensure the request goes to the server instead of being cached at the browser, and,
Secondly, to correlate the request with the return (this information is in the 'location' of the header).
This value is otherwise ignored by the server and can be any value.

responseMessages.message: Success. See the 'Response Class' section above for the description of the data.
Bad Request. Typically invalid or incomplete parameter(s). See the 'message' property for detail of the error.
No such Camera Image resource found
Failed Dependency; Camera is not generating images

operations.notes:
'Nudge' the camera's direction a few degrees in any combination of four directions.

parameters.name: nudge
parameters.description:
Direction and degrees in which to 'nudge' the camera.
For example:
{ "up": 1, "left":2 }

links.description:
*method=GET*Provides link relations as URLs using the REST 'hateoas' convention (for REST delivered data).
    The 'self' link references this rest object, including any specified query criteria,
    The 'rel/track' link references the track this camera is following, if any.

id.description: the resource identifier; the camera id

pan.description: [0.0 to 359.99]: camera's bearing direction in degrees (0 degrees is true north)

tilt.description: [0.0 to 180.0]: camera's tilt in degrees (90 degrees at the horizontal, 0 degrees is fully tilted down)

isPowerOn.description: [false, true]: boolean representing the state of the camera's power; not shown if server is offline (value is unknown and not applicable)

isServerOffline.description: [true]: boolean representing if the camera server is offline (else the field is not shown)

isAutoTiltOn.description: [false, true]: boolean representing whether the auto-tilt feature is on

fieldOfView.description: viewable presentation area measured by width and range

links.description:
*method=GET*Provides link relations as URLs using the REST 'hateoas' convention (for REST delivered data).
    The 'self' link references this rest object, including any specified query criteria

items.description: An array of Cameras matching the query criteria

totalItems.description: Total number of elements matching the query filter and not limited by page size

url.description: URL resulting in this error message

up.description: [0 to 90]:Move camera up this many degrees

down.description: [0 to 90]:Move camera down this many degrees

left.description: [0 to 90]:Move camera left this many degrees

right.description: [0 to 90]:Move camera right this many degrees

tilt.description: [0.0 to 180.0]: camera's tilt in degrees (90 degrees at the horizontal, 0 degrees is fully tilted down)

pan.description: [0.0 to 359.99]: camera's bearing direction in degrees (0 degrees is true north)

trackToAssign.description: Track ID to assign a Camera too. Track ID follows the form of 'COM0100002' where the first 2 digits represent the Tracker Source Id (TSI) (RP Unit Number) and the last 5 digits represent the Local Track ID (CTI).

width.description: Width of viewable presentation area (in degrees)

range.description: Range (in meters) for which the corresponding field of view width applies

latitude.description: [-90 to +90]: Latitude of the object (Decimal Degrees, North Positive/South Negative)

longitude.description: [-180 to +180]: Longitude of the object (Decimal Degrees, East Positive/West Negative)

altitude.description: Height of the object above sea level (meters)

gotoPosition.description: Location in which to point the camera

value1.description: CONFIRM THE FOLLOWING: First value for the given generic command (unchecked). For PanTilt, this is the pan (bearing) in degrees (where 0 is true north), For Volume, this is the volume level, For Mute, this is 0 (un-mute) or 1 (mute), For Scene, this is 1 thru 6 to represent the scene (the video client)

value2.description: CONFIRM THE FOLLOWING: Second value for the given generic command (unchecked). For PanTilt, this is the tilt in degrees, where 0 points down and 180 points up
